Articles.Content:
Firstly, as has been said...just wow! beautiful work. I think this is the way forward for a program like this.

This is a wonderful gathering of some fabulous work.

I do have a problem with the update (I think)...

The external camera you had included (I don't have the name now) appears to be missing from your latest update.

Is this intentional?

If so, I shall have to start my station build from scratch again ![:(](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_sad.gif)

Love ya work!

> 
> Firstly, as has been said...just wow! beautiful work. I think this is the way forward for a program like this.
> This is a wonderful gathering of some fabulous work.
> 
> I do have a problem with the update (I think)...
> 
> The external camera you had included (I don't have the name now) appears to be missing from your latest update.
> 
> Is this intentional?
> 
> If so, I shall have to start my station build from scratch again ![:(](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_sad.gif)
> 
> Love ya work!

Just looked at the download and there missing there from ASET the ExtCamRadialVert you can get them here [https://www.dropbox.com/s/9hd1fk8kwzxadz8/ALCOR_IVA_Patch_0.9.2.3.zip](https://www.dropbox.com/s/9hd1fk8kwzxadz8/ALCOR_IVA_Patch_0.9.2.3.zip)

EDIT- And Alex has some very nice landing legs you can see and get here [http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/54925-1-0-2-ALCOR-Advanced-Landing-Capsule-for-Orbital-Rendezvous-by-ASET-%2805-05-2015%29?p=1975136&viewfull=1#post1975136](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/54925-1-0-2-ALCOR-Advanced-Landing-Capsule-for-Orbital-Rendezvous-by-ASET-%2805-05-2015%29?p=1975136&viewfull=1#post1975136)

**Edited <time datetime="2015-06-07T04:03:41Z" title="06/07/2015 04:03  AM" data-short="9 yr">June 7, 2015</time> by Mecripp2**
Now if only our governments could work as fast as people like this! thankyou very much. brilliant!

> 
> Now if only our governments could work as fast as people like this! thankyou very much. brilliant!

There's no monkey around here, O wait guess there is ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif) maybe No business like monkey business hehe ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)
![4vW1xf.jpg](http://imageshack.com/a/img673/2659/4vW1xf.jpg)

That's really cool looking! The problem is the size. It can't be anymore sized down in RAM, but can you make different download packs that contain different parts like launchers, crew vehicles, rovers etc. I probably won't need all of this awesome stuff. And have another question. Are there Mars/Duna direct parts in this pack?

It's not really a pack that you'd want to split up in that way, I don't think. The ships are complex, and it would be very hard to make most of them with other parts stripped away. 

Can confirm that the latest download now loads all the parts correctly in Sandbox mode, even with the other 70 odd mods I'm running. Not unlocked full tech tree in career yet, so not sure if it works in that mode. Can anyone else confirm?

I'm currently using this in my career save and well I'm on Linux so when it comes to part mods ive got uh.. All of them lol. So its really hard to tell if something is missing. I have about half the tree unlocked and so far I've got a good portion of CMES parts. There probably needs some balancing, but so far the parts are there. 

So I got half a mind so try this on a bone stock install, cheat the tree unlocked and then see. Maybe even get rid of Squads parts to make it easier. Thing is... How exactly could I go about checking off each and every part in this pack? Should I just cross reference every single part in gamedata or is there a better list of sorts I can use?

Oh the craft files maybe. If I were to unlock the entire tree, enable stock craft then see if any of the sub assemblies or CMES crafts can't load because of a part missing. If I can load them all.. then is it safe to say all the parts are in the tree? Forgive me if its a stupid question, but are there parts in this pack that might not be in a .craft?

Yeah it's in the factory being wired up.

\* *hey jimmy how's that lite version coming along?* \*

( long silence )

Okay so he says it's just him back there and Chaka didn't show up today, something about going out last night... 

Oh, here's Chaka ... yeah He's lookin a little slow this morning

![GFp9TR.jpg](http://imageshack.com/a/img540/9676/GFp9TR.jpg)

Looking at this photo... one thought occurs to my mind and I must ask...

Do you have a cat?
There is one problem I found. I can't transfer crew from the Altair to the Orion. Where's the crew hatch?

i want chaka......

- - - Updated - - -

why dont the orion docking ports have chutes

> 
> i want chaka......
> - - - Updated - - -
> 
> why dont the orion docking ports have chutes

Are you using Realchutes ? 

EDIT- And they do have chutes just thinking even if you had realchutes they still should show up just not work that good.
oh no i dont have realchutes

Is there anything in your log or debug ? Or you using tweakeverything ?

EDIT- Let me loaded up and check

EDIT- Dang, I have the same problem in my Main CMES install which haven't got to start yet.

**Edited <time datetime="2015-06-07T20:32:58Z" title="06/07/2015 08:32  PM" data-short="9 yr">June 7, 2015</time> by Mecripp2**

no and no

- - - Updated - - -

hmmm idk what to do

> 
> Looking at this photo... one thought occurs to my mind and I must ask...
> Do you have a cat?

Labrador Retriever and a roomba that follows him around

![8J16y6.jpg](http://imageshack.com/a/img913/1041/8J16y6.jpg)

> 
> no and no
> - - - Updated - - -
> 
> hmmm idk what to do

Maybe I dont understand... It definitely *has* parachutes. 

![rA1PmC.jpg](http://imageshack.com/a/img537/4721/rA1PmC.jpg)

> 
> There is one problem I found. I can't transfer crew from the Altair to the Orion. Where's the crew hatch?

We have a pending service request with the manufacturer on that issue, it's a bit complicated.

**Edited <time datetime="2015-06-07T21:43:36Z" title="06/07/2015 09:43  PM" data-short="9 yr">June 7, 2015</time> by YANFRET**
is it only on the black docking port??

![vOZiHw.jpg](http://imageshack.com/a/img907/6627/vOZiHw.jpg)

Absolutely not...

However we do need to re calibrate the drag settings on the emergency chutes clipped inside the capsule... I'm working that issue now.

Also on Altair crew transfer, I'm going to test Sarbian's Crew Manifest to see if that can get the little guys out of there.

Of course there is always the old fashioned way, with a quick EVA as well.

**Edited <time datetime="2015-06-07T21:59:43Z" title="06/07/2015 09:59  PM" data-short="9 yr">June 7, 2015</time> by YANFRET**

I use Papa Joe's Ship Manifest and will test that too.

Update: Ship Manifest transfer works.

**Edited <time datetime="2015-06-07T22:50:24Z" title="06/07/2015 10:50  PM" data-short="9 yr">June 7, 2015</time> by Voidryder**
  
Update

YANFRET was that a save craft ? they do have chutes but if you grab that docking port in VAB it's funny you can see the settings but no staging and have added that missing line to the cfg but must be doing something wrong.

EDIT- And lines not missing, I'm just blind

**Edited <time datetime="2015-06-07T22:42:37Z" title="06/07/2015 10:42  PM" data-short="9 yr">June 7, 2015</time> by Mecripp2**
In the VAB when I click on the part I do get the parachutes, although they don't work very well because of how old the models are, that's why we have to nest the new squad parachutes as well.
HEHE Getting a bigger monkey hammer to look for that bug.

I just pulled the whole thing apart and re coded it but so we're on the same page, you guys do not see this?

![kGYuZE.jpg](http://imageshack.com/a/img540/3209/kGYuZE.jpg)
